identity.description: The identity of the container registry.

location.description: The location of the resource. This cannot be changed after the resource is created.

properties.description: The properties of the container registry.

sku.description: The SKU of the container registry.

virtualNetworkSubnetResourceId.description: The Virtual Network Subnet Resource Id of the agent machine

cpu.description: The CPU configuration in terms of number of cores required for the run.

type.description: The type of package source for a archive.

packageSource.description: The package source of the archive.

publishedVersion.description: The published version of the archive.

isSecret.description: Flag to indicate whether the argument represents a secret and want to be removed from build logs.

passwordSecretIdentifier.description: KeyVault Secret URI for accessing the password.

usernameSecretIdentifier.description: KeyVault Secret URI for accessing the username.

expiresIn.description: Time in seconds that the token remains valid

refreshToken.description: The refresh token used to refresh the access token.

scope.description: The scope of the access token.

token.description: The access token used to access the source control provider.

status.description: The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

baseImageTriggerType.description: The type of the auto trigger for base image dependency updates.

updateTriggerEndpoint.description: The endpoint URL for receiving update triggers.

updateTriggerPayloadType.description: Type of Payload body for Base image update triggers.

credentialSetResourceId.description: The ARM resource ID of the credential store which is associated with the cache rule.

targetRepository.description:
Target repository specified in docker pull command.
Eg: docker pull myregistry.azurecr.io/{targetRepository}:{tag}

clientTokenIds.description: The list of the ACR token resource IDs used to authenticate clients to the connected registry.

garbageCollection.description: The garbage collection properties of the connected registry.

logging.description: The logging properties of the connected registry.

loginServer.description: The login server properties of the connected registry.

mode.description: The mode of the connected registry resource that indicates the permissions of the registry.

notificationsList.description: The list of notifications subscription information for the connected registry.

parent.description: The parent of the connected registry.

customRegistries.description:
Describes the credential parameters for accessing other custom registries. The key
for the dictionary item will be the registry login server (myregistry.azurecr.io) and
the value of the item will be the registry credentials for accessing the registry.

sourceRegistry.description: Describes the credential parameters for accessing the source registry.

authCredentials.description:
List of authentication credentials stored for an upstream.
Usually consists of a primary and an optional secondary credential.

loginServer.description: The credentials are stored for this upstream or login server.

identity.description:
Indicates the managed identity assigned to the custom credential. If a user-assigned identity
this value is the Client ID. If a system-assigned identity, the value will be `system`. In
the case of a system-assigned identity, the Client ID will be determined by the runner. This
identity may be used to authenticate to key vault to retrieve credentials or it may be the only
source of authentication used for accessing the registry.

password.description:
The password for logging into the custom registry. The password is a secret
object that allows multiple ways of providing the value for it.

userName.description: The username for logging into the custom registry.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

arguments.description: The collection of override arguments to be used when executing the run.

credentials.description: The properties that describes a set of credentials that will be used when this run is invoked.

dockerFilePath.description: The Docker file path relative to the source location.

imageNames.description: The fully qualified image names including the repository and tag.

isPushEnabled.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image built should be pushed to the registry or not.

noCache.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image cache is enabled or not.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

sourceLocation.description:
The URL(absolute or relative) of the source context. It can be an URL to a tar or git repository.
If it is relative URL, the relative path should be obtained from calling listBuildSourceUploadUrl API.

target.description: The name of the target build stage for the docker build.

type.description: The type of the run request.

arguments.description: The collection of override arguments to be used when executing this build step.

imageNames.description: The fully qualified image names including the repository and tag.

isPushEnabled.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image built should be pushed to the registry or not.

noCache.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image cache is enabled or not.

target.description: The name of the target build stage for the docker build.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

credentials.description: The properties that describes a set of credentials that will be used when this run is invoked.

encodedTaskContent.description: Base64 encoded value of the template/definition file content.

encodedValuesContent.description: Base64 encoded value of the parameters/values file content.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

sourceLocation.description:
The URL(absolute or relative) of the source context. It can be an URL to a tar or git repository.
If it is relative URL, the relative path should be obtained from calling listBuildSourceUploadUrl API.

type.description: The type of the run request.

values.description: The collection of overridable values that can be passed when running a task.

encodedTaskContent.description: Base64 encoded value of the template/definition file content.

encodedValuesContent.description: Base64 encoded value of the parameters/values file content.

values.description: The collection of overridable values that can be passed when running a task.

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

options.description: The list of all options configured for the pipeline.

target.description: The target properties of the export pipeline.

keyVaultUri.description: They key vault secret uri to obtain the target storage SAS token.

type.description: The type of target for the export pipeline.

uri.description:
The target uri of the export pipeline.
When 'AzureStorageBlob': "https://accountName.blob.core.windows.net/containerName/blobName"
When 'AzureStorageBlobContainer':  "https://accountName.blob.core.windows.net/containerName"

status.description: The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

credentials.description: The properties that describes a set of credentials that will be used when this run is invoked.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

sourceLocation.description:
The URL(absolute or relative) of the source context. It can be an URL to a tar or git repository.
If it is relative URL, the relative path should be obtained from calling listBuildSourceUploadUrl API.

taskFilePath.description: The template/definition file path relative to the source.

type.description: The type of the run request.

values.description: The collection of overridable values that can be passed when running a task.

valuesFilePath.description: The values/parameters file path relative to the source.

taskFilePath.description: The task template/definition file path relative to the source context.

values.description: The collection of overridable values that can be passed when running a task.

valuesFilePath.description: The task values/parameters file path relative to the source context.

enabled.description: Indicates whether garbage collection is enabled for the connected registry.

schedule.description: The cron expression indicating the schedule that the connected registry will run garbage collection.

userAssignedIdentities.description:
The list of user identities associated with the resource. The user identity 
dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: 
'/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/
    providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

options.description: The list of all options configured for the pipeline.

source.description: The source properties of the import pipeline.

trigger.description: The properties that describe the trigger of the import pipeline.

keyVaultUri.description: They key vault secret uri to obtain the source storage SAS token.

type.description: The type of source for the import pipeline.

uri.description:
The source uri of the import pipeline.
When 'AzureStorageBlob': "https://accountName.blob.core.windows.net/containerName/blobName"
When 'AzureStorageBlobContainer': "https://accountName.blob.core.windows.net/containerName"

action.description: The action of IP ACL rule.

value.description: Specifies the IP or IP range in CIDR format. Only IPV4 address is allowed.

identity.description: The client id of the identity which will be used to access key vault.

keyIdentifier.description: Key vault uri to access the encryption key.

auditLogStatus.description: Indicates whether audit logs are enabled on the connected registry.

logLevel.description: The verbosity of logs persisted on the connected registry.

defaultAction.description: The default action of allow or deny when no other rules match.

arguments.description:
Gets or sets the collection of override arguments to be used when
executing a build step.

contextPath.description: The source context against which run has to be queued.

file.description: The file against which run has to be queued.

target.description: The name of the target build stage for the docker build.

updateTriggerToken.description: Base64 encoded update trigger token that will be attached with the base image trigger webhook.

values.description: The collection of overridable values that can be passed when running a Task.

id.description: The resource ID of the parent to which the connected registry will be associated.

syncProperties.description: The sync properties of the connected registry with its parent.

forceUpdateTag.description: How the pipeline run should be forced to recreate even if the pipeline run configuration has not changed.

request.description: The request parameters for a pipeline run.

artifacts.description:
List of source artifacts to be transferred by the pipeline. 
Specify an image by repository ('hello-world'). This will use the 'latest' tag.
Specify an image by tag ('hello-world:latest').
Specify an image by sha256-based manifest digest ('hello-world@sha256:abc123').

catalogDigest.description: The digest of the tar used to transfer the artifacts.

pipelineResourceId.description: The resource ID of the pipeline to run.

source.description: The source properties of the pipeline run.

target.description: The target properties of the pipeline run.

status.description: The current status of the source trigger.

sourceTrigger.description: The source trigger properties of the pipeline.

os.description: The operating system type required for the run.

azureADAuthenticationAsArmPolicy.description: The policy for using ARM audience token for a container registry.

exportPolicy.description: The export policy for a container registry.

quarantinePolicy.description: The quarantine policy for a container registry.

retentionPolicy.description: The retention policy for a container registry.

softDeletePolicy.description: The soft delete policy for a container registry.

trustPolicy.description: The content trust policy for a container registry.

id.description: This is private endpoint resource created with Microsoft.Network resource provider.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

actionsRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

description.description: The description for connection status. For example if connection is rejected it can indicate reason for rejection.

status.description: The private link service connection status.
The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

adminUserEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether the admin user is enabled.

anonymousPullEnabled.description: Enables registry-wide pull from unauthenticated clients.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: Determines the domain name label reuse scope.

dataEndpointEnabled.description: Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data.

encryption.description: The encryption settings of container registry.

metadataSearch.description: Determines whether registry artifacts are indexed for metadata search.

networkRuleBypassOptions.description: Whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry.

networkRuleSet.description: The network rule set for a container registry.

policies.description: The policies for a container registry.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public network access is allowed for the container registry.

zoneRedundancy.description: Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry

regionEndpointEnabled.description: Specifies whether the replication's regional endpoint is enabled. Requests will not be routed to a replication whose regional endpoint is disabled, however its data will continue to be synced with other replications.

zoneRedundancy.description: Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry replication

days.description: The number of days to retain an untagged manifest after which it gets purged.

status.description: The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

agentPoolName.description: The dedicated agent pool for the run.

isArchiveEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether archiving is enabled for the run or not.

logTemplate.description: The template that describes the repository and tag information for run log artifact.

actions.description:
The list of scoped permissions for registry artifacts.
E.g. repositories/repository-name/content/read,
repositories/repository-name/metadata/write

description.description: The user friendly description of the scope map.

type.description:
The type of the secret object which determines how the value of the secret object has to be
interpreted.

value.description:
The value of the secret. The format of this value will be determined
based on the type of the secret object. If the type is Opaque, the value will be
used as is without any modification.

isSecret.description: Flag to indicate whether the value represents a secret or not.

name.description: The name of the overridable value.
The SKU name of the container registry. Required for registry creation.

retentionDays.description: The number of days after which a soft-deleted item is permanently deleted.

status.description: The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

branch.description: The branch name of the source code.

repositoryUrl.description: The full URL to the source code repository

sourceControlAuthProperties.description:
The authorization properties for accessing the source code repository and to set up
webhooks for notifications.

sourceControlType.description: The type of source control service.

identity.description:
The Entra identity used for source registry login.
The value is `[system]` for system-assigned managed identity, `[caller]` for caller identity,
and client ID for user-assigned managed identity.

loginMode.description:
The authentication mode which determines the source registry login scope. The credentials for the source registry
will be generated using the given scope. These credentials will be used to login to
the source registry during the run.

sourceRepository.description: The properties that describes the source(code) for the task.

sourceTriggerEvents.description: The source event corresponding to the trigger.

messageTtl.description: The period of time for which a message is available to sync before it is expired. Specify the duration using the format P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S as per ISO8601.

schedule.description: The cron expression indicating the schedule that the connected registry will sync with its parent.

syncWindow.description: The time window during which sync is enabled for each schedule occurrence. Specify the duration using the format P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S as per ISO8601.

tokenId.description: The resource ID of the ACR token used to authenticate the connected registry to its parent during sync.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

agentPoolName.description: The dedicated agent pool for the task.

credentials.description: The properties that describes a set of credentials that will be used when this run is invoked.

isSystemTask.description: The value of this property indicates whether the task resource is system task or not.

logTemplate.description: The template that describes the repository and tag information for run log artifact.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

step.description: The properties of a task step.

trigger.description: The properties that describe all triggers for the task.

forceUpdateTag.description: How the run should be forced to rerun even if the run request configuration has not changed

overrideTaskStepProperties.description: Set of overridable parameters that can be passed when running a Task.

taskId.description: The resource ID of task against which run has to be queued.

type.description: The type of the run request.

contextAccessToken.description: The token (git PAT or SAS token of storage account blob) associated with the context for a step.

contextPath.description: The URL(absolute or relative) of the source context for the task step.

schedule.description: The CRON expression for the task schedule

encodedPemCertificate.description: Base 64 encoded string of the public certificate1 in PEM format that will be used for authenticating the token.

expiry.description: The expiry datetime of the certificate.

creationTime.description: The creation datetime of the password.

expiry.description: The expiry datetime of the password.

credentials.description: The credentials that can be used for authenticating the token.

scopeMapId.description: The resource ID of the scope map to which the token will be associated with.

status.description: The status of the token example enabled or disabled.

baseImageTrigger.description: The trigger based on base image dependencies.

sourceTriggers.description: The collection of triggers based on source code repository.

status.description: The value that indicates whether the policy is enabled or not.

actions.description: The list of actions that trigger the webhook to post notifications.

customHeaders.description: Custom headers that will be added to the webhook notifications.

scope.description: The scope of repositories where the event can be triggered. For example, 'foo:*' means events for all tags under repository 'foo'. 'foo:bar' means events for 'foo:bar' only. 'foo' is equivalent to 'foo:latest'. Empty means all events.

serviceUri.description: The service URI for the webhook to post notifications.

status.description: The status of the webhook at the time the operation was called.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

The properties of the scope map.
The properties associated with the task run, i.e., request and result of the run

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives
